id: bigtech:sky sports killed off its femalefocused halo brand after jus:2025-11-17T01:14:40.000Z
title: Sky Sports killed off its female-focused Halo brand after just three days
author: Terrence O’Brien
summary_long: That Sky Sports felt the need to launch a TikTok channel specifically marketed towards women and billed as its “lil sis” was questionable enough. But once people got a taste of the content on Halo, it was clear the company had absolutely no idea what it was doing. Halo didn’t focus on women’s sports, nor did it seem to be doing a good job of elevating female voices in a male-dominated business. Instead, it slapped pink sparkly letters on videos, talked about “hot girl walks,” matcha, and posted shipping memes. Source: www.theverge.com. Date: 2025-11-17. Why it matters: outline likely impact on technology, business, or society. What’s next: note near-term developments or signals to watch.

id: consumer:google plans to invest 40 billion towards building data cent:2025-11-16T18:30:56.000Z
title: Google plans to invest $40 billion towards building data centers in Texas
author: Jackson Chen
summary_long: Google is getting ready to spend $40 billion to increase its data center footprint in Texas. In an announcement posted on its website, Google said it's planning to build more infrastructure for its cloud and artificial intelligence operations in the state. The plans call for three new data centers, one in Armstrong County and two in Haskell County, according to Google. According to a press release from Texas Governor Greg Abbott, this is Google's largest investment in any US state. Source: www.engadget.com. Date: 2025-11-16. Why it matters: outline likely impact on technology, business, or society. What’s next: note near-term developments or signals to watch.

id: consumer:rivian spinoff reveals a 3500 starting price for its first e:2025-11-16T19:59:50.000Z
title: Rivian spinoff reveals a $3,500 starting price for its first e-bike
author: Jackson Chen
summary_long: Rivian's electric mobility spinoff Also announced a $3,500 starting price for its first e-bike called the TM-B. The startup unveiled the shapeshifting e-bike last month, with options for a limited Launch edition, a Performance version or a base model. During the reveal, Also said both the Launch and Performance TM-B models would start at $4,500, but only hinted at the base model's price tag being less than $4,000. While the base model TM-B is more than $1,000 cheaper than the other choices, it comes with several compromises, like a lower max range of 60 miles, a weaker 5x power assist, coil fork suspension and only a standard ride mode. Source: www.engadget.com. Date: 2025-11-16. Why it matters: outline likely impact on technology, business, or society. What’s next: note near-term developments or signals to watch.

id: space:live coverage spacex falcon 9 to launch international satell:2025-11-17T00:59:50.000Z
title: Live Coverage: SpaceX Falcon 9 to launch international satellite to keep watch on rising sea levels
author: Steven Young
summary_long: The second spacecraft in a billion-dollar international mission to keep watch rising sea levels is scheduled to launch from California Sunday night, local time, weather permitting. The Sentinel-6B satellite will liftoff atop a SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket from Space Launch Complex-4E at Vandenberg Space Force Base at 9:21:42 p.m. PST (12:21:42 a.m. EST / 0521:42 UTC), almost exactly five years after its twin, the Sentinel-6 Michael Freilich, launched from the same pad. Source: spaceflightnow.com. Date: 2025-11-17. Why it matters: outline likely impact on technology, business, or society. What’s next: note near-term developments or signals to watch.

id: bigtech:the evolution of rationality how chimps process conflicting :2025-11-16T12:00:34.000Z
title: The evolution of rationality: How chimps process conflicting evidence
author: Jacek Krywko
summary_long: When Aristotle claimed that humans differ from other animals because they have the ability to be rational, he understood rational to mean that we could form our views and beliefs based on evidence, and that we could reconsider that evidence. “You know—ask ourselves if we should really believe that based on the evidence we’ve got,” says Jan M. Engelmann, an evolutionary anthropologist at the University of California, Berkeley. Engelmann says that from the beginning of the Western intellectual tradition, people thought that only humans are rational. Source: arstechnica.com. Date: 2025-11-16. Why it matters: outline likely impact on technology, business, or society. What’s next: note near-term developments or signals to watch.

id: bigtech:you need to listen to the searing noise pop album forever in:2025-11-16T22:31:27.000Z
title: You need to listen to the searing noise pop album Forever in Your Heart
author: Terrence O’Brien
summary_long: There's something irresistible about music that sounds as if it's coming apart at the seams. The Black Dresses are masters of barely contained chaos. All of their records feel as if they're in danger of collapsing into pure noise at any moment. But never have they so expertly woven the various threads of their sound - glitchy percussion, pummeling guitars, irresistible pop hooks - together as they do on Forever in Your Heart. Source: www.theverge.com. Date: 2025-11-16. Why it matters: outline likely impact on technology, business, or society. What’s next: note near-term developments or signals to watch.

id: consumer:the mac pro could be the latest addition to apples product p:2025-11-16T16:56:09.000Z
title: The Mac Pro could be the latest addition to Apple's product purgatory
author: Jackson Chen
summary_long: The wait for a new Mac Pro may take a lot longer, according to the latest Power On newsletter. Bloomberg's Mark Gurman reported that the Mac Pro has an uncertain future within Apple's desktop strategy and isn't likely to see a refresh in 2026. According to Gurman, Apple is no longer working on the M4 Ultra chip, which was meant to be offered in a refreshed Mac Pro. Instead, Apple is planning for the M5 Ultra to be its "high-end desktop chip," which will only be available on the Mac Studio so far, according to Gurman. Source: www.engadget.com. Date: 2025-11-16. Why it matters: outline likely impact on technology, business, or society. What’s next: note near-term developments or signals to watch.
